entry.title: Roseburg Forest Products Shuts Down Weed, California Veneer Plant
entry.summary: Roseburg Forest Products has closed its Weed, Calif., veneer plant, shifting production to Oregon mills as part of a broader restructuring. About 140 employees will receive transition support, and the company says it remains committed to investing in the Weed community.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 12.3.25
entry.summary: State Representative Alek Skarlatos announced that he has filed for re-election. He talked about what is ahead in the upcoming short session of the legislature, and his priorities going forward.

entry.title: HIGHWAY 42 PAVING AND SAFETY IMPROPROVEMENT PROJECT CONTINUES
entry.summary: December 3, 2025 10:50 a.m. The Highway 42 paving and safety improvement project continues between Winston and Green. An update from the Oregon Department of Transportation said safety features being added should help reduce crashes through the Green District. Sidewalk curb ramps are being upgraded to better accommodate wheelchair users and other pedestrians. The new...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE OFFER SAFETY TIPS AS HOLIDAYS APPROACH
entry.summary: December 3, 2025 10:30 a.m. The Roseburg Police Department is offering safety tips as the winter holidays approach. *Protect packages: Try to schedule deliveries for times when someone is home, use secure pickup locations when possible, and keep an eye out for suspicious activity in the neighborhood. Report any concerns to non-emergency dispatch at 440-4471....

entry.title: OREGON LOTTERY TRANSFERS $887 MILLION BACK TO STATE
entry.summary: December 3, 2025 10:10 a.m. The Oregon Lottery will return more than $887 million to the state for the 2025 fiscal year. An Oregon Lottery release said compared to the previous year, the transfer is approximately $60 million less due largely to 2024 administrative savings that weren’t available this year. The transferred amount includes unclaimed...

entry.title: Winston Domino’s Donates Over $1,000 to Support the Winston–Dillard Food Bank
entry.summary: Domino’s in Winston raised over $1,000 and collected canned goods for the Winston–Dillard Food Bank during a community meet-the-owner event, where new franchise owner Angelique Martinez thanked locals for their generosity and support.

entry.title: Douglas County Man Sentenced to 14 Years in Federal Prison for Drug Trafficking and Firearms Crimes
entry.summary: A Douglas County man was sentenced to 168 months in federal prison for trafficking fentanyl and methamphetamine and illegally possessing firearms. DINT noted the sentencing concludes a prior investigation in which the suspect attempted to flee detectives.

entry.title: TRUE WEALTH 12.2.25
entry.summary: Presented by Littlejohn Financial, David Littlejohn and Matt Dixson have our weekly local look at financial information.

entry.title: DOUGLAS COUNTY MAN SENTENCED TO FEDERAL PRISION FOR DRUG DEALING
entry.summary: December 2. 2025 4:40 p.m. On Tuesday, a Douglas County man was sentenced to federal prison for selling fentanyl and methamphetamine and illegally possessing firearms. A release from the U.S. Attorney’s Office – District of Oregon said 51-year-old Glenn Allen Gearhart was sentenced to 168 months in federal prison and five years of supervised release....

entry.summary: Roseburg Public Library Director Kris Wiley talks about input they are seeking to help formulate a new strategic plan, plus covers a number of upcoming activities.

entry.title: Winston-Dillard Festival Association Plants New Community Christmas Tree at Civic Wayside Park
entry.summary: A new 15 foot Douglas fir has been planted at Civic Wayside Park to serve as Winston’s permanent community Christmas tree. Installed with help from Winston Public Works and Wildwood Nursery, it will be used for future tree lighting ceremonies starting December 6.

entry.title: State and county officials go on Sherm's shopping spree to fight hunger for the holidays
entry.summary: For all the joy they can bring, the holidays can just as easily turn into a time of stress as families in need struggle to afford food on top of seasonal obligations.

entry.title: 7,000 veterans to be honored with Wreaths Across America
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — The Douglas County Wreaths Across America committee has announced that the John Pierson Memorial Wreaths Across America event will take place Saturday, Dece. 13 at the Roseburg National Cemetery.

entry.title: Umpqua Fishery Enhancement Derby announces 34th annual event

entry.title: Employment in Douglas County: Reports delayed again
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Employment reports for Douglas County and other parts of Oregon have been delayed again, due to the recent federal government shutdown.

entry.title: HOLIDAY DECORATIONS CAN CAUSE HOME FIRES
entry.summary: December 2, 2025 2:50 a.m. Holiday decorations can cause home fires. entry.title: A Night of Light and Community: Douglas County Gathers for the 42nd Annual Courthouse Tree Lighting
entry.summary: The 42nd Annual Christmas Tree Lighting filled the Douglas County Courthouse lawn with warmth, cheers, and hometown spirit as families gathered to welcome the holiday season.

entry.title: Stuff N' Things Opens in Myrtle Creek with Deep Community History
entry.summary: Stuff N' Things has opened in Myrtle Creek, bringing back a beloved local tradition of antiques and vintage finds. Owner Brittany is continuing her family’s legacy and invites the community to stop by the new shop next to Ray’s.

entry.title: UACT embraces holiday chaos with 'Have Yourself a Crazy Little Christmas'
entry.summary: For many, Christmas is a time for gathering, family, giving and joy. For the Crowder family, it's also a time for drama, chaos and chasing down a loose pet ferret.

entry.title: Douglas County Fairgrounds temporarily closes riding arenas to prevent spread of equine herpes
entry.summary: In the cold and wet winter months, indoor facilities provide equestrians with a way to socialize and stay active with their horses. But in Douglas County, those equestrians may have to wait.
